Description: Three fragments of a tubular belt, wool knitted, mainly black but colour changing to a yellowy-green at the two ends. At the ends the stitches are brought together and additional red and undyed (linen) and yellow-green threads form a plaited tail ending in a little tassel of loose threads.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Qasr Ibrim (Nubia), West Tower Tomb Burial B?
Acquisition name: Division of Finds: Egyptian Antiquities Organisation
